painPoints.description: Difficulty in finding and contacting committee chairs through the app.
supportingQuotes: my only challenge with the app was when there was something that I couldn't do, I couldn't figure out how to tell the committee chair that I wouldn't be there, like I couldn't figure out who the committee chair was and all that
on the app, I can't find the committees. I can, you know, I can go to the events that I am registered for.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: High - mentioned multiple times with frustration.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: User has to navigate to the website to find committee chair information.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Increases frustration and complicates the process of attending events.

painPoints.description: Overwhelming amount of events and difficulty navigating them.
supportingQuotes: there's just so many things, and it's overwhelming, and how do you help people organize it so they don't, they can see just the parts that they're most relevant to them?
my most, the most prevalent one is just figuring out how do I figure out which things to look through.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: High - consistently mentioned as a significant issue.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: User scrolls through events but finds it time-consuming.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Leads to missed events and increased effort in event selection.

painPoints.description: Lack of filtering or sorting options for events.
supportingQuotes: the filtering of events would be nice on the app and the website.
I don't know if there's a way to do it, how to just sort by just certain kinds of events.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate - mentioned as a desired feature.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: User manually searches through events without filtering.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Makes it difficult to find relevant events efficiently.

painPoints.description: Confusion regarding reading and understanding terms and conditions.
supportingQuotes: I'm pretty sure I didn't read them and I just clicked okay.
I think probably what I did and probably what most people do is like this has got to be fine, I don't want to read all the fine print.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate - indicates a common user behavior.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users typically skip reading these documents.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Users may be unaware of important terms and conditions that affect participation.

painPoints.description: Inconsistencies and delays in communication about event details.
supportingQuotes: I haven't gotten the address yet that I am, but I can see who's registered.
it was now, because it would have been an email a couple of days ago, probably.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate - mentioned in relation to specific events.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users check their email for updates, but may miss details.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Leads to confusion about event logistics and potential missed events.
